Produced by the American Dental Association courtesy of a grant from Colgate-Palmolive in 1974, "The Haunted Mouth". It features actor Cesar Romero as the narrator, "B. Plaque".  This "scary movie" is actually all about dental hygiene and preventing cavities, and in it the invisible spirit of plaque (Romero) warns children against the dangers of not brushing and flossing. The film shows the enemies of plaque including toothpaste, toothbrushes, and dental floss (7:25), and discusses the proper method for brushing and flossing.  

Cesar Julio Romero Jr. was an American actor and activist, known for his portrayal of the Joker in the Batman TV show, but also for a wide range of screen roles including Latin lovers, historical figures in costume dramas, and characters in light domestic comedies.
